file_content.text: I'm sure they'll send me another holorecording specialist soon.
The holodiscs--you've got them! That's fantastic, amazing, unexpected even. I can't wait to see the footage from when the bodies were--wait. Where's Waxx?
Turns out he joined the separatists.
He joined the enemy.
Blast. And since he didn't come back with you, I'm guessing he didn't give up the holodiscs willingly.
Now it'll take a miracle to convince him to come home. Stupid kid--always sympathizing with the underdog a little too much.
The only thing I found was the holodiscs.
No idea.
I'm sure he'll turn up. Likely taken in by the romance of the movement and all that. He'll come toddling back when he gets bored.
The separatists killed him.
Dead.
Ah, poor kid. He was always getting caught up in the romance of different movements and societies. I guess it finally caught up with him.
Anyway, fair's fair. Here are your credits. Spend them in good humor.
Take care.
I really hope the recordings are worth it.
Make those discs count.
It's been fun.
Right. It's footage like this that makes all the fighting and death worth it, you know?
Look, I see your face and I know what you're gonna say, so don't even bother.
Waxx is with the separatists, right? Or he was adopted by a separatist family, or he's training in firearms, or some other blasted stupid thing. Am I right?
He's gone completely native.
You're right.
How did you know?
You knew?
He's just that type of kid, isn't he? On Tatooine, he went to live with the Jawas for three months--thought they were his spiritual kin.
He wouldn't give me the holodiscs. Do I still get a reward?
I'd still like a reward.
Yeah, I suppose you deserve something. After all, we know Waxx is alive, and he's got the footage.
One day he'll realize that the separatists are just as immoral as everyone else. And hopefully by then, he'll have some fantastic footage.
In the meantime, I'll get a new holorecorder sent out here and gather what I can. Here's a little something for your time and effort.
Thanks.
Take care.
You're as crazy as Waxx is.
You're nuts.
If you get yourself shot, I'll do a story on you!
Waxx has got to be over there across the bridge--or at least the footage has to be....
Listen, if you're here to tell me to clear out, then I'll tell you the same thing I told that uptight commander: Not going to happen. Got it?
I've got as much right as you do to be here--in fact, I've got more. I'm a model of free speech, a paragon for posterity.
What are you? A local grunt, that's what. No good to anybody. So don't go telling me to clear out. I won't do it and that's that.
I'm not here to tell you to clear out.
That's not why I'm here.
Nice try there, gunslinger. I know your type like I know the galaxy, which is like the back of my hand--
Had some trouble with the local troops?
You sound frustrated.
Are you trying to smooth-talk me, gunslinger? Con me? You trying to play good soldier and--
Bad attitude.
That's not attitude--I'll show you attitude. You like that, don't you? Seeing spirited citizens stand up for themselves and--
Oh damn, you're not actually with the locals, are you? Sorry about that, my mouth always engages first. Brain's working now, though, and I got an idea.
I need something done, and I don't have enough credits to bribe the whole corrupt Ord Mantell army. I've got enough to bribe a smaller army, though. You for hire?
Depends.
Think of it as an adventure. Wait--no, don't do that. You'll wander off aimlessly. Think of it as a job.
I could always use more credits.
As long as you're paying.
Fantastic, good to see someone with the complete lack of scruples needed to protect justice and freedom in the Republic.
I don't take bribes.
I'm not for sale.
So don't call it a bribe, call it... a spurious outpouring of generosity for a job well-done.
A bit busy right now, actually.
Not now.
Then make yourself unbusy. Look, this is about bigger things than you and me and way more important than your schedule.
My partner and I were in Mannett Point recording stories of the uprising when the separatists attacked, bombs everywhere, carnage like you wouldn't believe. Fabulous footage.
My partner got lost--good kid but not a lot upstairs, you know. He's still out on that island somewhere.
I'll find your partner.
I'll go get him.
I take it the local troops weren't helpful?
No one's offered help?
Don't make me laugh. The only time anything gets done on Ord Mantell is when there's a hefty bribe involved. That's why we're playing private contractor.
So it's a rescue mission?
You want him back?
Ha! Sure, why not? I mean, he was a nice kid. I'm more worried about the holorecordings we took of the uprising, though.
No promises.
I don't care--just get it done. A girl who waits for other people to keep their promises is a girl who dies alone.
Look, if you can find my partner and bring him back, great. His name is Waxx, and he's a self-important little holorecording specialist.
If he's dead or whatever, I'll still pay you for the holodiscs if you can find them. Great footage on there, fantastic, gory stuff.
I'll be back.
Anything to support the arts.
Sounds like a worthy cause.
Goodbye, crazy woman.
Sure, whatever. Just get away.
Bring me those discs!
I'm not moving until I have the story of my career!
